glsa.title: Amarok: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in Amarok might allow for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Amarok is an advanced music player.

description.p: Tobias Klein has discovered multiple vulnerabilities in Amarok:

ul.li: Multiple integer overflows in the Audible::Tag::readTag() function in metadata/audible/audibletag.cpp trigger heap-based buffer overflows (CVE-2009-0135).

Multiple array index errors in the Audible::Tag::readTag() function in metadata/audible/audibletag.cpp can lead to invalid pointer dereferences, or the writing of a 0x00 byte to an arbitrary memory location after an allocation failure (CVE-2009-0136).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted Audible Audio (.aa) file with a large "nlen" or "vlen" tag value to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Amarok users should upgrade to the latest version:
